pages.title: ORSA Portable O2 System
pages.text: $(bold)ORSA Mk.I-III Compressed Oxygen Canisters$()$(br2)When the atmosphere freezes (Phase 6 late), your $(l:orsa_equipment/eva_suit)EVA suit$(/l) alone can't save you — it needs breathable air.$(br2)Carry an O2 Canister in your inventory while wearing a full EVA suit. One tick of breathing, one tick of O2 consumed.$(br2)$(italic)ORSA Safety Tip: Hyperventilating does not conserve oxygen. We checked.$()

pages.title: How It Works
pages.text: $(bold)Automatic:$() The EVA suit detects the canister and draws from it. No button-pressing required.$(br2)$(bold)Multiple tanks:$() Consumed sequentially. Your O2 HUD shows $(bold)combined$() remaining air across all tanks.$(br2)$(bold)Refilling:$() Place any canister in a $(l:advanced/geothermal_core)Geothermal Core's$(/l) O2 slot. Refills at +10 O2/tick. Higher-tier tanks take longer.

pages.title: Mk.I — O2 Canister
pages.text: $(bold)Capacity:$() 60 seconds$(br)$(bold)Bar Color:$() Cyan$(br2)The standard-issue canister. One minute of breathable air. That's how long ORSA thought you'd need between airlocks. ORSA assumed you'd have airlocks.$(br2)$(italic)"We allocated portable airlock budget. Kevin spent it on a breakroom espresso machine. It's frozen now too."$()
Iron, glass, and a Thermal Core. The core regulates gas pressure.

pages.title: Mk.II — O2 Canister Mk.II
pages.text: $(bold)Capacity:$() 120 seconds$(br)$(bold)Bar Color:$() Blue$(br2)Diamond-reinforced casing, double compression. Two minutes of air. Enough to walk somewhere, realize you forgot something, and walk back.$(br2)$(italic)ORSA Procurement notes this is the most expensive air you will ever breathe. Until the Mk.III.$()
Surround a Mk.I with diamonds. Yes, diamonds. For a metal tube full of air.

pages.title: Mk.III — O2 Canister Mk.III
pages.text: $(bold)Capacity:$() 180 seconds$(br)$(bold)Bar Color:$() Purple$(br2)$(l:advanced/frozen_atmosphere_shard)Frozen Atmosphere Shards$(/l) and blue ice create a cryogenic chamber holding three minutes of air at absurd density. The canister is cold to the touch. Uncomfortably cold.$(br2)$(italic)"Three minutes doesn't sound like much. But when there's no air outside your helmet, it's everything."$()
Frozen Atmosphere Shards, blue ice, and a Mk.II. You're bottling the sky.
